alert.note: Alert for Hillsborough (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 10 at 11:51PM EDT until July 12 at 1:41AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by elevated rivers and streams. * WHERE...Portions of central and southern New Hampshire, including the following counties, in central New Hampshire, Sullivan. In southern New Hampshire, Cheshire and Hillsborough. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding will continue overnight as runoff from earlier rain keeps small streams and river elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1144 PM EDT, The area has received 1 to 4 inches of rainfall over the last 24 hours, leading to elevated small streams and rivers. In particular, the Ashuelot River remains in minor flood along with several tributaries. Low lying properties and roads remain flooded which will continue through late morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Keene, Jaffrey, Swanzey, Winchester, Gilsum, Antrim, Marlborough, Fitzwilliam, Hancock, Dublin and Richmond.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
